title: Why is it possible for humans to sleep 12+ hours a day continuously but not go into hibernation for a week, month or season? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is possible for the regular pattern of human sleep to be significantly disturbed. There are several sleep disorders relevant to your question such as Kleine–Levin syndrome - Wikipedia and Narcolepsy - Wikipedia. I would argue that Kleine-Levin sydrome especially appears like hibernation at first glance. It certainly suggests that hibernation is likely to be possible in humans.

Only some lemurs are known to hibernate among primates, hibernation is not in our nature, it may even not exist in our dna at all.Do not expect to hibernate soon.http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2015/12/151203111221.htm Sorry Quora is getting annoying with their preconception of a good answer so I have to keep writing a little more.
